intro: Globulostylis minor, commonly known as the small globular grass, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Poaceae family, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its compact, globular growth habit. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically arranged in spikelets. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in rocky or disturbed habitats. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
